definition: to give a dinner party/to entertain guests/to invite to dinner
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: The twenty-seventh is my birthday, I plan to put up a marquee and throw a party .
sentences.chinese: 二十七是我的生日，我还要搭个棚呢，请请客。

sentences.english: They’d like to invite guests over more often, too.
sentences.chinese: 他们也希望能够更多地请客人们到家里去。

sentences.english: This dinner is on me. Please order whatever you want to have.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我请客，你想吃什么随便点吧。

sentences.english: No, we'll go Dutch. I don't like to freeload.
sentences.chinese: 不，各付各的，我不喜欢让别人请客。

sentences.english: They first registered to marry, then held a junketing in restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他们先登记注册结婚，然后在餐馆请客。

sentences.english: The adjudicating personnel shall not accept a treat or gift from the parties or their agents.
sentences.chinese: 审判人员不得接受当事人及其诉讼代理人请客送礼。

sentences.english: Let's enjoy the performance played by pupils from Grade Two.
sentences.chinese: 请欣赏由二年级同学表演的儿童剧《小熊请客》。

sentences.english: This lunch is on me today.
You said this cup of wine to your treat, for him to come to see your performance.
sentences.chinese: 你说这杯酒要你请客，感谢他能够过来看你的表演。

sentences.english: Although I didn't really want anything more to eat, I insisted on paying for the milkshakes.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我没想再吃东西，我还是坚持由我来请客。

sentences.english: B: OK, loser buys pizza tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 好，输的人明天晚上请客吃比萨饼。

sentences.english: Disco Bear goes trick-or-treating for Halloween, but gets more tricks than he bargains for!
sentences.chinese: 不请客就捣乱，万圣节迪斯科熊有什么收获？

sentences.english: It's going to be my treat today - I'll pay the bill.
sentences.chinese: 你马上上菜，今天这顿饭我包了，我请客。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
